Reviews.Title: “Pacific Hotel, London”
Reviews.Author: babsan1
Reviews.Content: Tiny room with a very hard bed. Curtains that did not cover the window. A shower that at best was dripping, forget to wash our hair. Sitting on the toilet you have your knees under the zink.

Reviews.Title: “Lastminute.com error”
Reviews.Author: Fairypants
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via lastminute.com but the images shown to me on the website didn't match up with the hotel at all. I was under the impression I was booking somewhere with grounds and a pool, couldn't have been more wrong. Stuck with the resevation but really wish I hadn't. The room was grim, wall paper peeling off the walls and that type of thing. There was a single bed in our room that we didn't ask for or want and it took up precious room space. The Grisham two doors down the road was far nicer when i stayed there last year

Reviews.Title: “not pacific”
Reviews.Author: Swingelish
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cheap but not cheerful. It is worth paying a little extra for a better standard.

Reviews.Title: “B&B pretending to be a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Screennam
Reviews.Content: If this was advertised as a simple bed and breakfast, I would have no issue with it. However, it ambitiously purports to be a four star hotel, which it simply is not. If you're just after a bed to lay your weary head and a breakfast then fine. If you want anything more glamorous, such as tea-making facilities or shower gel, go for somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute decision”
Reviews.Author: B00ts_Electric
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel after deciding on the day we wanted to spend the night in London and knew this area was 'hotel land'. The room served it's purpose really and gave us a comfortable bed and a breakfast (of sorts). The price was quite good for London, though this is no luxary hotel. The bathroom was tiny and the place could seriously do with a referb. The breakfast consisted of toast, 1 rasher of bacon, 2 fried eggs and a desert spoonfull of beans... pretty skimpy, but set us up til lunch. I would only stay here again if I was on a tight budget and wasn't bothered about staying somewhere nice. It is conveniently situated within walking distance from Paddington Station.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Timsofy
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and were quickly checked in and given our room key. As soon as we entered our room we were met by a strong scent of washing detergents. This was not surprising considering that outside one of the windows there was a clear view into the hotels laundry facilities. Moreover there was a pipe right outside the window that spewed out clouds of steam from the washing machines inside the washing facilities. Since people in our family have allergies for these type of things, we asked for another room. The answer was that this was the best room in the hotel and was the only three man room at the time. As a result of that we ended up in a two man room, however there was none of the smell we had encountered in the other room. The only thing to complain about in this room was the view we had from the windows. There were huge stock piles of old mattresses laying on the floor outside. Sure we were living below ground floor, but I would like to expect something of a better view rather than seeing old mattresses and other rubbish outside my window. The location of the hotel is the only good thing I can come up with now. We had good access to the tube and the National Rail service. It took about 3-4 minutes to walk to Paddington station. From Paddington you could take the Bakerloo, Circle or District line to were you needed to go. The Hotel is also located quite close to Hyde Park, but we did not have the time to pay a visit during our trip, unfortunately. The food experience in the hotel was amongst the worse we have had. Every morning for breakfast you were given two strips of beacon, a fried egg and some baked beans, with little other choice. The portions that were served were also quite small.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't need sleep this hotel is an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: HMT59nl
Reviews.Content: To cut a long story short: the people are friendly, the traffic noise is terrible and goes on all night. The rooms are poor but clean. Breakfast is very simple but allright.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if Possible, Too expensive for such Poor Quality”
Reviews.Author: markmmm
Reviews.Content: Stayed there , booked at last minute, very expensive for what wwere very small and poorly furnished rooms, one bathroom smelt terribly, would never stay there again, main objection is such poor value for money, if price was reduced 50 % would not find it so objectional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RayneCapeTown
Reviews.Content: I often read these reviews and wonder exactly what people's expectations are considering what they paid: Having paid 50 Euros per night, bed and breakfast, I think this Hotel is a HUGE bargain. My colleague and I stayed for three nights, our rooms were perfectly clean, bathrooms small but adequate considering what a bathroom is meant for, and all in all we had a great time. The staff were very friendly and helpful, it is two minutes walk away from the station etc etc. I do wish people would consider that YOU GET WHAT YOU PAID FOR!!! I think it is unfair to compare a bicycle with a Porsche!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a kennel”
Reviews.Author: Consultant4
Reviews.Content: After a long day at work to arrive at this dump was hugely demoralising. At half the price this hotel is way to expensive. A kennel is too good a description - rooms are pokey, the shower is horrible, the TV did not work, severla lights did not work. I goy out as soon as I could in the morning. Stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “It is simply not worth the money you pay for it”
Reviews.Author: sch2010
Reviews.Content: From where we booked the hotel, it was marked with three stars. The actual rating should be 1 or two stars. The rooms cry out for maintenance / redecoration. The pictures on the web are quite misleading compared to the rooms we got. Details: very worn out rooms, wallpaper coming off, dripping water taps, drain not working properly, very dirty rooms and bathrooms, extremely minimalistic equipped rooms. Putting your towels on the floor does not mean they will be changed - same towels for a week or until you complain to the reception. On the postive side: The evening/night receptionists were very helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AVOID AVOID”
Reviews.Author: Bazzalot
Reviews.Content: This is the most disgusting place. We were show a shabby tired room, no way are the website photos the same hotel. There was an old wardrobe would not shut, stains on the bedspead, but what really made us leave was the faeces in the toilet and all over the toilet brush. The toilet would not flush and someone had put toilet cleaner over the whole mess, the brush I presume had been used to try and get rid of everything. No way is this 3 star at best I would say a very poor B & B or doss house. Went elsewhere and were told by front counter they had advised the booking agency to refund our money. Still waiting. One point in each box because site would let me do otherwise, I would prefer a zero score.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: oldgnr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated for sight-seeing. We were greeted with a smile! Very pleasant and helpful staff throughout. The room was adequate, clean and tidy. But the bathroom was very cramped. There is no lounge area or bar. English breakfast was adequate and nicely cooked with plenty of toast and coffee/tea. In our particular room it was very quiet at night, therefore experienced a good night's sleep. All in all a very pleasant 3 night stay. Good value for money considering London prices. Would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, just forget it”
Reviews.Author: istigs
Reviews.Content: I completely agree with Kiwis on the 9/8-08. We expirienced just the same. We booked on the Normandie Hotel, but we could not stay there because of a dirty and filthy room. Because of this we were sent to Pacific Hotel, and were offered a room on the ground floor where we expirienced that it was impossible to sleep because of heavy trafic 24 hours a day. These hotels are probably owned by the same people, and we expirienced the samt lack of service both on the Normandie and on the Pacific. The room was terrible, bathroom small and filthy and the breakfast was terrible. Fawlty Towers (John Cleese) is a 6 star hotel compared to Pacific Hotel. Should never be called a hotel. Rather a bed & breakfast, or rather only a bed. STAY AWAY FROM THIS "HOTEL".

Reviews.Title: “stay well clear of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiwisNewZealand
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms were generally filthy, the shower and toilet were digusting and stunk of sewerage, we had no hot water (when complained of this the owners did nothing, not even an apology), blankets were stained and filthy, no tea or coffee making facilities, owners very unhelpful and didn't care when we complained about these issues. My husband and I are very hardened travellers and stayed in many places all round the world but this hotel is by far the worse. In fact this is the first review I have ever written and this is because I have never felt so strongly disgusted about accomodation before, other travellers need to be aware! The worst part however, is that we never even booked into this hotel, we had booked into the Normandie Hotel about 30 metres down the road, but when we arrived there, they said our room had been allocated in this rather downgraded disgusting place. Apparently it is owned by the same owners. I complained about this too, but once again the owners of the Normandie hotel did not care. We had also booked 2 rooms, as we were travelling with another couple and they too were put into another hotel again, meaning that we had all separated. Unfortunately we had pre-paid for the hotel because we booked it through expedia, so we were unable to get our money back and go somewhere else. My advise is simply, just don't even consider this hotel, it really is disgusting, you can get far better accomodation for the same price elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: QCK
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel and would not rate it a 3 star. Location is on a very busy street and very noisy. No fans or AC in the rooms so if you want any air in the room you have to keep the window open hence the loud noise from the street. Due to some renovation, paint fumes along with cigarette smoke smells were heavy in the hallways and rooms. When we went to the breakfast room at the time breakfast should have started being served, the staff was just getting in so we had to skip breakfast to get to the airport. For what we paid for these rooms, we did not get our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: LenInToronto
Reviews.Content: Single rooms are extremely noisy from buses turning and accelerating. Windows shake and earplugs useless. Went down to cancel room after 2 days and owner was yelling at a telephone caller for calling too many times - all incoming calls are through the front desk. When I canceled he tried to keep the tax portion on the remaining days (15%VAT) and did not know how to credit my card. I had to yell a lot to get the full refund (I did not use an agency). Also there is no WiFi in range of the rooms. There are many other great, kind, professional hotels owners in the area like the St. David, which I switched too.

Reviews.Title: “Quite decent for London”
Reviews.Author: AussieinFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: Okay, we booked and paid â‚¬100 through a German website for this 3 star hotel, and after a disasterous stay the previous year in a 2 star hotel, we were apprehensive: 'hoping for the best but expecting the worst'. Anyway, we got the best. Nice little reception area and a nice clean room that had been freshly painted. It was fairly/very small, but when you consider it probably used to be a maids room.....Anyway, we were only in London for 48 hours so we only wanted to shower and crash - which is exactly what we did. The bathroom was also very small, but good, and the shower had a big old shower head that instantly poured buckets of endless piping hot water over your head - FULL MARKS for the shower. 'Decent English breakfast ' (if you eat that sort of thing). The area is absolutely fantastic, hundreds of hotels, lots of resturants - but quiet! Very close to Hyde Park, friendly owner from Cypress. London is expensive, but I think for our money we were very happy. We are going back - no question!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away...Far away”
Reviews.Author: FQT
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in, was advised would be given a "good" room. the room smelled of mold and was not clean. The linens were threadbare and did not appear very clean either. The bathroom curtains were moldy. Despite the fact that the hotel is advertised as having a lift, the lift does not, in fact, go to the lower floor so if you have bags, be prepared to be your own porter. When leaving, heard the owner advising a potential guest that the rack rate of GBP 120 for a night at the Pacific was a "good" rate, when a quick scan of the rate at the nearby Hilton London Paddington (5-star) on Expedia was showing rates not much more that the "good" rate he was offering. Yes, London hotels are known to be pricy, but there are better deals out there.

HotelInfo.Name: Pacific Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 108 Sussex Gardens | Hyde Park, London W2 1UA, England
